projects.entry: The Natural Orifice Surgery / Scarless operations (NOS / SLO) working group had its first meeting in Berlin, Germany.
The second meeting of the NOS / SLO working group took place at the Savoy Hotel, Berlin. More information on [the NOS/SLO working group](http://www.nesacademy.org/interdisciplinary.html#NOS)

Michael Stark and George Peltecu took part as advisors in the WHO conference ['Safe Surgery Saves Lives'](http://www.who.int/patientsafety/events/08/10_01_2008_geneva/en/index.html), which took place in Geneva, Switzerland. The NESA participates in the formulation and distribution of a surgical checklist that will contribute to the safety of surgery. 

 The NESA has signed a Letter of Endorsements, showing herewith its support of the creation of the Safe Surgery Saves Lives Project by the WHO World Alliance of Patient Safety.
The NESA participated in the launching of the WHO checklist in Washington.

During the **SOGOG 2008** and **1st National Congress on Evidence Based Ob/Gyn Practices**, Michael Stark delivered the **Silver Jubilee Oration**. The conference was hosted by the Ahmedabad Obstetrics and Gynaecological Society.
The NESA was invited to conduct the conference- **The delivery room in the 21st century â€“ humanity and security.**
The NESA conducted a [surgical course in Wroclaw, Poland](http://www.poltowgin.pl/files/STARK.pdf).
Michel Odent, London, and Michael Stark conducted a seminar in Taranto, Italy, concerning quality in obstetrics and gynaecology.
The NESA, in cooperation with FIGO and MedicalAidFilms, conducted a surgical and ultrasound course at the Yalgado Ouedragogo hospital in Ouagadougou, Burkina Faso.
